data.title: In Loving Memory: Charles Hall Jr.'s Obituary
data.meta_description: Honoring the life and legacy of Charles Hall Jr. at Mobile Memorial Gardens Cemetery. Explore their obituary and pay your respects to a cherished soul who will forever remain in our hearts.
data.text:
Charles William Hall, Jr. (Chuck) a lifelong resident of Mobile, AL born April 3, 1959 passed away September 16, 2019 after a three-year battle with Pancreatic Cancer. Chuck was a Retired Mobile Police Officer with 33 years of service, he had the honor of being recognized as Officer of the Month three times during his career. He is preceded in death by his grandparents MJ and Dell Brown and Wilburn and Eunice Hall. He is survived by Yvette Theriot, fianc√©, Charles and Sammie Hall, parents, Keith (Tami) Hall, brother, Steve (Kayla) Hall, brother, children, Charles Hall III, Samantha Hall, Brandy (Shane) Bethea, Kasey (Jacob) Cotten seven grandchildren, nieces and nephews. Chuck enjoyed Mardi Gras, Fishing, and Alabama Football he served as President of a well-known Mystical Society and founded the Mobile Mystical Friends Mardi Gras Society. He was a Mason and a Shriner. In lieu of flowers, the family request that you make a donation to ABBA Shrine Transportation Fund, 7701 Hitt Road, Mobile AL 36695. The family will receive friends on Thursday, Sept. 19, 2019 from 5:00pm until 8:00pm at Radney Funeral Home, 3155 Dauphin St, Mobile AL. 36606. And 11:00 am until time of Funeral services on Friday Sept. 20, 2019, 12:00pm from First Baptist Church-St. Elmo, 8950 Roberts Rd., Irvington, AL. 36544. Burial will follow in Mobile Memorial Gardens. Serving as Pallbearers will be; Keith Hall, Steve Hall, Charles Hall III, Stanley Ward, Nick Hall, Scott Hall, Cole Hall and Jacob Cotten, Honorary Pallbearers; MJ Brown, Todd Brown, Ronnie McNeil, Dave Theriot, David Theriot and Rick Lose.

1959-2019
